@karaswisher The move is open to any of the big social platforms:

1. Have a huge audience
2. Decide one day that you’re not a platform, you’re a publisher
3. Hard dial your pub to one set of opinions
4. Lose 60-70% of audience
5. Keep 30-40% who now LOVE it
6. $$$!

Huge * 0.35 = Still huge
@karaswisher Like, I’d never considered that angle before. In a commercial sense it is entirely plausible. Someone could make a lot of money with a digital-first version of Fox.

Missed this last year, but here’s a really fascinating thread:
@MarceloPLima Hopefully Elon is just exaggerating the cost by an order of magnitude or two. Otherwise hard to see how Starlink could ever be a real company.

@MarceloPLima … so Starlink really is covering the full cost for all 25k customers: $100M for 25k customers for 8 months is $6,000 in annual COGs per customer. Add in a share of SG&A, R&D and the enormous capex and they’d need to charge tens of thousands a year to break even.

@MarceloPLima You can’t count D&A because that’s happening whether or not Ukrainians are using the service. It’s not “costing” StarLink anything.

Let’s just assuming everyone else is lying when they say they paid for their own terminals and/or subscription fees …

@typesfast Similarly, this would only be true for hypothetical “subsistence Coca Cola investors” who use their returns to buy gas and milk, etc. The returns for most actual Coca Cola investors go to categories where that inflation is not relevant (and of which many are declining).

@typesfast If the CPI categories represent 100%-ish of your income, then you don’t have a “portfolio.”

As asset prices deflate, you’re actually getting a better deal: $1 gets you more BRK/MSFT/DIS today than a few months ago. $1 will probably get you more house in 6 months than today … https://t.co/xgdpTFmSzu

We encourage those who are fortunate enough to be in a position to donate to also consider the many other worthy organizations (@rescueorg, @unicef, @msf, etc.) active in relief efforts in Ukraine & elsewhere (Yemen, Syria, Afghanistan, DRC, etc.) This world needs 💪 & ❤️

"All” means no need to tweet receipts (or even read this): we’ll get the total donations worldwide & match that, up to $2.5M.

I’ve personally had a tour of the backend & seen how vetting & approvals happen. We believe this direct giving model is worthy of investment and scaling.

🇺🇦 The @1kproject has delivered 5,000+ USD$1k direct cash grants to Ukrainian families. Immediate help, no strings, in a time of wrenching crisis. 100,000+ families waiting.

@endtwist Theoretically, should work. In Safari it just does nothing (no text is pasted, even if the clipboard is plain text). In Chrome there's a 50-50 chance of invisible markup which won't show in the composer (and sometimes not even in your sent folder) but does on the recipient's end.

@therealfitz I never thought about the actual words. I took it as a traditional form of salutation embedded deeply in the IVR culture, the equivalent of "hello, how are you today" or "peace and blessings be upon you."

@timheiler I wrote it & made the gif, Oliver Chacon did the original arrow animations for a presentation I gave at our investor day, and someone many years ago (I think at Yahoo?) whiteboarded a bunch of circles with arrows pointing in different directions and talked about alignment.

Think of this as a big karmic opportunity. Want to pay it forward? Here’s a place we can help.

We could collectively have their whole $562M funded next week, but let’s aim for $100M … *this* week.

Will RT/link to contributions (or tweet them without attribution if you prefer).

But also …
▶️ A CHALLENGE TO OTHER LEADERS IN TECH ◀️
 
It should be easy to raise $100M from software/internet/tech. Many of us had banner years. No one was profiteering, but a strange side effect of a terrible global pandemic happened to be faster growth in our businesses.

Anything we can do to ensure a fast & equitable distribution of vaccines and accelerate turning them into vaccinations should be a worldwide priority. Every bit of help is welcome and will make a difference. Everyone can pitch in to #EndThePandemic
 
https://t.co/jKeNpwJbgT

The complexity is extreme: global procurement; pre-positioning solar refrigerators, syringes & PPE; secure vaccine transport & delivery; safe equipment disposal. There are no shortcuts. $562M more is needed. Getting $ faster means everything moves faster and every minute counts.

UNICEF is uniquely well-positioned to pull this off: they already operate the biggest vaccine procurement, storage, shipping & cold chain distribution network in the world, supplying 2B+ doses of vaccine annually across ~100 countries & vaccinating 45% of the world’s children.

Why @UNICEF? It is the COVAX partner responsible for getting shots in arms worldwide. WHO, Gavi & CEPI are, thankfully, covering the essential projects of vaccine approval, manufacture & funding. They handle vaccines; UNICEF handles *vaccinations*.

Watch: https://t.co/x96sye3ERO

Billions of new infections will inevitably create scores of new variants which will circulate, mutate & recirculate around the globe. New vaccine-resistant variants could put us back at square one. This is a global challenge, not a local one. We’re all in this together.

Second, we’re all connected: if we in rich countries allow it to take years to vaccinate the rest of the world, it’s not going to end for us either. Thankfully, the vaccines have mostly proven robust against the current variants so far. But evolution is wily, fast and powerful.

First, of course, is simply: human lives & human suffering are just as important in every country. We’re not through this and, for most of the world, it is likely to get worse. We may be on the verge of a more catastrophic humanitarian crisis than anything so far.

• Get comfortable w/ ⌘+[ and ⌘+] (the browser history shortcuts) to navigate
